data.title: Import the TS temperate tileset.
data.body:
This introduces the basic framework for a TS -> OpenRA tileset converter, and does an initial port of the temperate tileset.  This is still quite limited by the constraints of our tileset format, but I plan on fixing this by incrementally modifying our tileset and re-running the converter in stages through future PRs.

The tileset can be tested using my [ingame map editor](https://github.com/pchote/OpenRA/tree/ingame-map-editor) branch.

data.body:
if you build a hellipad close to the map edge (down\south) any hellicopter you build will exit the map and will never return

data.title: Improve the mission menu
data.body:
This implements the second phase of the mission menu plan:
- Support groups of related missions.
- Play briefing FMV before starting the mission.

data.title: Mods.Common resharpered
data.body:
Two basic commits for resolving some re sharper issues in the Mods.Common console space.

One commit also moves Console commands to the Commands namespace to follow folder structure.
Did it with Console originally, but that had nasty consequences.

data.title: Closure hazards -- Fixes #6703
data.body:
Mix of real bugs (the LevelUpCrateAction one would have caused a desync across different compilers) and benign issues.

Fix them all.

data.title: Increasing the Capacity from Silo and Refinery in TS
data.body:
This PR increases the Capacity from Silos and refinerys which should fixing the following:
- Stops EVA from Spaming "Silos needed" right after more than 3 silos...
- Silos should have more capacity as an Refinery
- AI stops blowing up the base with Tiberium Silos which causes a "never ends up process" and wasting the Buildable Space whith Silos: see screen:

![untitled](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2057932/4539383/5b747fb2-4dfc-11e4-8311-1bee2f0e8fa8.jpg)

It makes no sense to let the AI Building 3 Refinerys which is causing a never ending Tiberium Overload :(

data.title: Added notifications for new objectives to scripted missions
data.body: Fixes #6692

data.title: Small memory savings
data.body:
Two small changes which save some memory:
- Indexes into tile arrays are now stored as bytes instead of ints, since the only need to represent very small numbers. The CustomTerrain field in the Map class means this gains us about 5MiB back for medium sized maps.
- We don't store pre-calculated textures coordinate pairs in Sprite, preferring to store pre-calculated values for each corner and return pairs on demand. This allows us to store texture co-ords for sprites using only 4 floats instead of 8. We also remove the array as well. This saved about 5MiB in my tests.

data.title: Silo and Refinery Storage logic gets not updated correctly
data.body:
Im startint in TS-Mod with 5000 Credits ... building the PowerPlant, Refinery, barracks, powerplant weaponfactory, refinery ... and eva say "silos needed" ... everytime ... i build 3 silos ... silos needed ... building repeadly 3 silos ... 10 seconds later ... silos needed ... i have atm 7 silos and all are full and all silos showing the storage-state from silo 1!!! 

In TS there had every Silo its own State 2 worse full 4 empty .. but OpenRA shows all as full ... the state from silo 1 ! Also this Problems happened on Refinerys each refinery shows the state from Refinery 1 :(

ok .. im scrolling to the AI ... The AI has 16 Silos Oo and it continues building silos... :(

data.title: AI base Planing
data.body:
did you ever play stronghold crusader 1? 
in ther modding tools you can moddify how the AI builds its castles
its like a map editor
every AI got a multiple choice of castles specific for that AI
for example the wolf AI got like 3-4 castles
SO imagine if openra AI could use a simular way to build bases
if the Ai cant build that base here(obsticles) it will chose a new base plan from a list
even patrols could be implemented. like puting patrol waypoints.so the AI will use a patrol team to follow that waypoint.and a secont patrol team do the same on other patrol waypoint and so on.
the AI now dont build walls or patrol waypoints even in red alert 2 the patrol script its bad.

imagine how good that would be for openra AI.i mean its a step forward from stoneage!

tell me what you think

data.title: [TS] Add Nod Stealth Generator and GDI TechCenter to the AI
data.body:
The AI can now build:
- Nod Stealth Generator (Nod)
- Tech Center (Nod & GDI)
- Radar (Nod & GDI)
- Replaced GDI Transport (apc) with GDI Titan (mmch)

![untitled](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2057932/4539383/5b747fb2-4dfc-11e4-8311-1bee2f0e8fa8.jpg)

data.title: shortcut key "ESC" invalid in Tiberian Dawn under Linux system
data.body:
in the game process, when pressed the ESC button, the screen of the game change color to monochrome for less than a second and back to game again. If mouse click the "menu" icon on the map area, the game menu appear normally. But there isn't same bug in Windows version for sure.
found in playtest-20140927, seems that never found the bug in any early versions, because I use the shortcut key all the time.
system details: Debian 7.0.6 i386 with mono 2.10.8.1-8

data.title: Show "New Objective: foo" when a new mission objective is added.
data.body:
This is a fairly standard thing for games to do, and would remove the need to open the menu immediately after starting a mission to know what you're supposed to.

This would also be useful for missions like allies02, where additional objectives are added part-way through the mission.

data.title: Fix closure issue with mission objectives.
data.body: Fixes #6680.

data.title: Chinooks now accept deploy order inflight
data.body: Fixes https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/4775

data.title: DevEnableTech now displays from all factions
data.body: Fixes https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/5960

data.title: Moving generic RTS code from OpenRA.Mods.RA to OpenRA.Mods.Common [Superseded]
data.body:
- Moved a sizeable chunk of the Traits, Activities and Orders from the RA mod project to Common
- Fixed classes in OpenRA.Mods.D2k project being declared in namespace OpenRA.Mods.RA
- Dune 2000 and Tiberian Sun mods no longer have ANY dependencies on OpenRA.Mods.RA
- Restructured refinery-related code

Yes, it is a big commit, but it should get the job done. Anything that is left to be moved should be transferable with simple editions to the using statements and the namespace.

data.title: Revert "Some minor Cargo style fixes."
data.body: Fixes the naval transports on the RA shellmap, which were broken by #6647.

data.title: Added player name and color selection to Settings menu
data.body: The player settings had not been ported from the Tiberian Dawn UI in https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/3991. This brings them back as outlined in https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/6380 to serve as an alternative to the troubled lobby when it is not empty. https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/5802

data.title: reduplicate items in mission objectives window of Tiberian Dawn
data.body:
Like Campaign: Nikoomba's Demise, These words displayed in the Objectives window:
Mission: In progress
Secondary Destroy all GDI troops in the area
Secondary Destroy all GDI troops in the area
Secondary Destroy all GDI troops in the area

I think I don't really need to Destroy all GDI troops in the area for 3 times. I think it is just some display mistake.
Noticed in the playtest20140927, and the simlar things happen in the other solo missions.

data.title: Implemented Deviator nerve gas missiles as warheads
data.body: This does the proposed refactoring from https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/2838 now that the pre-requisites https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/6030 are in place and makes the owner change temporary as in the original. It was permanent, because I lacked the coding skills at the time when I hacked AttackLoyality.
